dublinCore.dc:title: HR 3085 ENR: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3349 West 111th Street in Chicago, Illinois, as the Captain Herbert Johnson Memorial Post Office Building.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen
form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3349 West 111th Street in Chicago, Illinois, as the Captain Herbert Johnson Memorial Post Office Building.

section.header: Captain Herbert Johnson Memorial Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3349 West 111th Street in Chicago, Illinois, shall be known and designated as the Captain Herbert Johnson Memorial Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Captain Herbert Johnson Memorial Post Office Building.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
